review: Somewhat impulsively, I hurried up and bought the Chromecast while I had the company training license to view some online educational videos. I wanted to watch the videos on my TV while sitting on the sofa at home, rather than at my desk. I do have VGA and HDMI cables to connect my laptop to the TV, but they're a bit of a nuisance. Instead, I plugged in the Chromecast, set it up in a few seconds, started a video, and set the laptop on the coffee table. The setup was simple, the instructions clear, and the interface with the Chrome browser is seamless.An added plus: When I needed a break from training, I found some dog videos on YouTube to entertain me and my cocker spaniel.Life can be beautiful!
